** Shares of major tech firms falling premarket after Facebook-owner Meta Platforms Inc's FB.O growth warning

** FB sinking >20% and on course for biggest one-day decline on record after co reported loss of daily users for the first time and said it expected slowing rev growth in coming qtr due to increased competition (Full Story)

** Other social media stocks dragged lower: Twitter Inc TWTR.N down ~7%, and Pinterest Inc PINS.N down ~8%, while Snap Inc SNAP.N, which is on tap to report its Q4 results after market close, slumps ~15%

** Tech heavyweights Microsoft Corp MSFT.O and Apple Inc AAPL.O fell ~1% each

** Amazon.com Inc AMZN.O, due to post results after the bell, slides 3.5%, while Alphabet Inc GOOGL.O slips ~1%

** Chipmakers Nvidia NVDA.O down 2.7% and Advanced Micro AMD.O off 1.3%

** Meanwhile, U.S. stock futures drop premarket with tech-heavy Nasdaq futures down ~2% .N


(Lance Tupper is a Reuters market analyst. The views expressed are his own)
